Sentencas: The combined solid oxide fuel cells and gas turbine (SOFC/GT) system is known to be a potential alternative for distributed power generation.
Titulo: Performance assessment and optimization of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine cogeneration system

Sentencas: In this paper, a novel SOFC/GT based cogeneration system, which integrated a transcritical carbon dioxide cycle (TRCC) with a LNG cold energy utilization system is proposed.
Titulo: Performance assessment and optimization of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine cogeneration system

Sentencas: A mathematical (zero-dimensional) model is developed to analyze the co-generation system performance from the perspective of thermodynamic (energy and exergy) and economic costs.
Titulo: Performance assessment and optimization of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine cogeneration system

Sentencas: The main parameters of the system are chosen to analyze their effects on thermodynamic performance.
Titulo: Performance assessment and optimization of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine cogeneration system

Sentencas: The results show that the current system can achieve 64.40% thermal efficiency and 62.13% exergy efficiency under given conditions, and can further improve efficiency through parameter optimization.
Titulo: Performance assessment and optimization of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine cogeneration system

Sentencas: Finally, the multi-objective optimization program using NSGA-II (Non-dominated Sorting Genetic Algorithm II) is used to obtain the optimal value of the system design parameters.
Titulo: Performance assessment and optimization of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine cogeneration system

Sentencas: In the multi-objective analysis, the thermodynamic efficiency and economic cost of the system are considered as objective functions.
Titulo: Performance assessment and optimization of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine cogeneration system

Sentencas: The optimization results show that the final optimized design selected from the Pareto front can achieve 63.08% thermal efficiency and 61.10% exergy efficiency, respectively.
Titulo: Performance assessment and optimization of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell-gas turbine cogeneration system
